articles.author: Bart Meijer, Dominique Vidalon
articles.description: Rubio's comments underline mounting frustrations in the White House over a lack of progress in pushes to settle a growing list of geopolitical challenges.
articles.title: US will abandon Ukraine peace efforts if no progress made soon, Rubio says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. strikes on a fuel port in Yemen killed at least 38 people on Thursday, Houthi-run media said, one of the deadliest days since the United States began its attacks on the Iran-backed militants.
articles.title: US strike on Yemen fuel port kills at least 38, Houthi media say

articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko, Christian Lowe
articles.description: Kyiv said on Friday it aims to complete talks by the end of next week about a deal with Washington on jointly exploiting Ukrainian mineral resources, an agreement Ukrainian officials hope will go some way to firming up softening U.S. support for them in their war with Russia.
articles.title: Ukraine says aiming to wrap up mineral deal talks within a week

articles.author: Crispian Balmer
articles.description: The Italian language proved a secret weapon for Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni as she launched a charm offensive with U.S. President Donald Trump and his deputy JD Vance in back-to-back transatlantic meetings.
articles.title: Melodic Italian bolsters Meloni in talks with Trump and Vance

articles.author: Hannah Lang, Judith Langowski
articles.description: Last week, a pack of rice crackers at Sun Vin Grocery store on Mulberry Street in New York City’s Chinatown cost $4.99.
articles.title: Insight: In US Chinatowns, merchants ‘don’t want the trade war to be a war’

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iran told the United States in talks last week it was ready to accept some limits on its uranium enrichment but needed watertight guarantees President Donald Trump would not again ditch a nuclear pact, a senior Iranian official said on Friday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Iran wants guarantees Trump will not quit a new nuclear pact, Iranian official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli airstrikes hit around 40 targets across the Gaza Strip over the past day, the military said on Friday, hours after Hamas rejected an Israeli ceasefire offer that it said fell short of its demand to agree a full end to the war.
articles.title: Israeli strikes hit dozens of targets in Gaza as ceasefire efforts stall

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian court handed down a prison sentence of nearly three years to Darya Kozyreva, a young activist who used 19th-century poetry and graffiti to protest the conflict in Ukraine.
articles.title: Russia jails 19-year-old for nearly three years for condemning Ukraine conflict

articles.author: Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Officials will discuss major steps to restore support for Syria from the World Bank and International Monetary Fund at spring meetings next week, though sanctions remain a major obstacle to rebuilding the country, a U.N. official said on Friday.
articles.title: IMF-World Bank meetings to discuss restoring support for Syria, UN official says

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: A U.S. judge on Friday denied Sean Diddy Combs' bid to delay his upcoming sex-trafficking trial by two months.
articles.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs loses bid to delay to sex-trafficking trial
